article_text:
Mark Zuckerberg gave a visionary keynote address last week at the annual Facebook conference for developers. “We are one global community,” he declared, with the aspiration to “give everyone the power to share everything with anyone.” But Mr. Zuckerberg announced his great ambition just as the open Internet is slamming shut.

Facebook connects almost two billion people, but his 10-year goal to bring Internet access to everyone in the world looks doomed. China has invoked “Internet sovereignty” to build its own set of...

twitter.description: Information Age columnist L. Gordon Crovitz writes about President Obama’s “Splinternet” legacy—Mark Zuckerberg’s dreams at Facebook are at odds with the White House’s plans to surrender U.S. oversight of the Internet.
twitter.title: Obama’s ‘Splinternet’ Legacy

article_metadata.author: L. Gordon Crovitz

article_summary:
China has invoked “Internet sovereignty” to build its own set of...
Mark Zuckerberg gave a visionary keynote address last week at the annual Facebook conference for developers.
Facebook connects almost two billion people, but his 10-year goal to bring Internet access to everyone in the world looks doomed.
“We are one global community,” he declared, with the aspiration to “give everyone the power to share everything with anyone.” But Mr. Zuckerberg announced his great ambition just as the open Internet is slamming shut.
